garrett_changed.speaker: Narrator
garrett_changed.text: Garrett enters the cafe with a different energy today. He still moves slowly, but there's a purpose to his steps that wasn't there before.

garrett_announcement.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_announcement.text: *He takes a deep breath* I did something this morning. Something I haven't done in three years. I set only one place at the breakfast table.

garrett_explains.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_explains.text: It felt like betrayal at first. Then I realized - Eleanor never wanted that second place set for her ghost. She wanted me to live. Really live, not just exist around her absence.

garrett_revelation.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_revelation.text: I went to her grave yesterday. First time I could actually talk to her instead of just crying. I told her about this place. About you. About your dragon.

garrett_promise.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_promise.text: I told her I was going to be okay. That I was going to keep living, for both of us. And I felt... I felt like she was smiling.

player_respond_letting_go.speaker: Narrator
player_respond_letting_go.text: What do you say to Garrett?

choices.text: Eleanor would be proud of you.

garrett_humble.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_humble.text: Courage? No. Love. She gave me fifty-two years of love. I owe it to her to keep going. To find joy again, not just memories.

garrett_hopes.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_hopes.text: *His eyes water, but he's smiling* I hope so. I truly hope so. She always said I was stubborn. Took me three years to figure out what she already knew.

garrett_decision.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_decision.text: *He pulls out the worn recipe* I've decided something. This recipe... it doesn't belong in my pocket anymore. It belongs in a kitchen. A real kitchen, where it can bring joy to others.

garrett_hint.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_hint.text: But not today. Soon. When I'm ready to watch someone else make her bread... and smile instead of cry.
